title: Viola Davis dons fierce crimson jumpsuit gown at the grand opening of Tyler Perry Studios in Atlanta
text:
On Saturday, Tyler Perry threw a celebratory gala to unveil Atlanta's new Tyler Perry Studios as well as to pay homage to the actors who have inspired his journey from homelessness to history-making.

The 330-acre filming complex is the first major Black-owned movie studio in American history, as well as one of the largest production studios in the country in general.

Viola Davis and her husband Julius Tennon were just two of the dozens of A-list attendees at the star-studded event.

Cause for celebration: Viola Davis, 54, and her husband, Julius Tennon, 65, were just two of the dozens of A-list attendees at the star-studded Atlanta event

Davis, 54, looked powerful in a strapless crimson jumpsuit gown that featured a dramatic pointed sweetheart neckline and pants with a cape skirt.

The dress showed off her toned, Michelle Obama-esque biceps, which are just two reasons why she was cast to play the first lady in the new Showtime series, First Ladies.

She paired the look with black stilettos, wearing her hair in a voluminous natural curly 'fro.

The Academy Award winner accessorized with a small black clutch, letting her dress do the rest of the talking.

Power pose: Viola looked powerful in a strapless crimson jumpsuit gown that featured a dramatic pointed sweetheart neckline and pants with a cape skirt

Boss Michelle Obama! The dress showed off Davis' toned, Michelle Obama-esque biceps, which are just two reasons why she was cast to play the first lady in the new Showtime series, First Ladies

Tennon, 65, looked dapper in a monochromatic ensemble.

The Dazed and Confused star wore all black from his tux to his tie to his dress shoes.

Davis and Tennon have been married since 2003 and share an 8-year-old daughter named Genesis.

Dapper days! Tennon looked dapper in a monochromatic ensemble

With 12 soundstages, 40 buildings on-site that are listed on the National Register of Historic Places and more than 200 acres of green space, Tyler Perry Studios aren't only historic in the current sense, they've got an interesting past history as well.

Perry bought Fort McPherson, a former Confederate military base, back in 2015 for $250 million and it's now the site of his massive studio.

The Diary of a Mad Black Woman star spoke about the historic studio while accepting the ultimate icon award at the BET Awards in June.

History in the making: Tyler Perry, 50, bought Fort McPherson, a former Confederate military base, back in 2015 for $250 million and it's now the site of his massive studio

'That studio was once a Confederate Army base... which meant that there was Confederate soldiers on that base plotting and planning on how to keep 3.9 million Negroes enslaved,' he said.

'Now, that land is owned by one Negro,' he said to a standing ovation, adding, 'It's all about trying to help somebody across.'

'While everybody was fighting for a seat at the table, talking about: "Oscars so white, Oscars so white," I said, "Y'all go ahead and do that, but while you're fighting for a seat at the table, I'll be down in Atlanta building my own,"' Perry said.
